reviews.content: Be sure to CAREFULLY check the hours they're open before getting care here. While technically an urgent care/walk-in clinic, there's a huge sign on the door saying "by appointment only".. Even though hours were listed until 9pm, I was turned away at the door 8:40pm because the office does not see new patients after 8pm (what???) and close early if no one arrived in the last half hour (what???).  . I left a rather frustrated message with the office and appreciated their apology and intent to make this scheduling policy more clear.

I guess some people are hard to please. I have no other explanation other then there are two sides to a story.Unless, Dr. Patel has listened to the reviews and made significant improvements.  He seems like the Doctor who wants to offer the very best service.  Sometimes, employees disappoint you.. My family of 4 adults have been going to Dr. Patel and staff for 3 years. The Nurse Practitioner, Stephanie Antepara who is pleasant, personable and attentive to you when you speak to her.  All fours of us have nothing but compliments for Stephanie the Nurse Practitioner.. Dr. Patel is VERY personable and listens attentively when you speak to him.  Not a common trait of many Doctors in my 65 years experience.. Some of the reviews I have read are so negative and off the mark, that I question who these people are and what the whole story is about their visit.  The negative comments don't seem, in my opinion, to be speaking about the same people that I have had the pleasure to experience.  It seems very suspicious.. Every time I call the office, the patient assistant who answers the phone listens and is very helpful.  I have been to a Doctor in Orlando for 10 years whose office NEVER answered the phone and every time I came into the office, his staff was all new people faces(4 or 5 people) every time!  You could never build any relationship with them,

Beware! This place is more of a greedy business than a medical care center. They made me pay out of pocket even though my insurance covers these types of visits, stating that they will refund me once they verify everything. It's been a year now, no refund from them. They made me wait 2 hours only to get seen by a physician assistant who told me that she couldn't help me and that there's nothing she could do. I'm a nurse practitioner myself and suggested the treatment or for her to at least prescribe me a medicine that can help me feel more comfortable. She down-played my condition and told me to just wait for the symptoms to go away on their own. And for this, I wasted two hours of my time, OH, and must I add, I ended up in the ER the next day because the pain got so bad. The ER doctor was able to help me. Stay away from this place. They have the nerves to send me an email telling me to vote for them to be the top medical center in Orlando. What a joke!

Please take a moment and read. . Unfortunately this establishment has the most unprofessional staff, just awful!! I have been a patient at this establishment for about 5 years and today I realized how much I was NOT cared for, valued and respected. Two weeks ago I went to this office due to heavy coughs, I am not a smoker, thick mucus and fever. I was given prescriptions, by the nurse practitioner, for coughing, ONLY. 3 days later I went back due to no change to my condition and this time the nurse practitioner prescribed a weak antibiotics for seven days and now 2 weeks later not much has changed. I call the office and they recommended a chest X-Ray and when I went back they wanted to charge me for another visit. So 3 times in almost 2 weeks for the same sickness and they wanted to charge me for another office visit and refused to wave the fees. When I had an objection, the defensive staff did not hold back and advised me to go to another clinic if I did not like it. Suddenly there were 4 to 5 other nurses who were not even a part of the conversation I was having with the receptionist and all united, with complete unprofessional attitude started making uncalled comments."This is our clinic, if you don't like it you can go somewhere else" then the receptionist refunded the $70.00 I had paid as the office visit, yes I paid the fee, and told me the nurse practitioner was not going to see me and that I should go somewhere else. No doctor on the premises, no office manager, no one in charge to take over and stop the staff who had teamed up against your customer, your patient who your team should only focus on caring for, and healing their condition. Doctor Patel, it is too bad you were not there to see your staff's unacceptable behavior. If a patient comes to your office 3 times in 10 days for the same sickness, one that your providers have not been able to diagnose, it would not be a bad idea to wave the office visit fee!! Also in a situation like this your patients frustration should not be a surprise to your staff, and being defensive is NOT the way they should behave. I do give an A+ to your team for sticking to each other and kicking your patient out of your office. They certainly do work as a team!!
After 1 hour waiting they told my that my insurance is not accepted by them, the receptionist is very bad don't have an idea of customer service!! . Horrible

Worst customer service. I was assigned to this doctor by my insurance. 2 days ago, I get a call to make an appointment on the 4th at 1pm. At 12pm, I went to get in the car and notice I have a flat. I call them stating I am unable to make it as I have no ride. I am told I have to pay 25 for canceling or changing. I explained that this was not told to me when I set up the appointment. Stay away. I had a feeling they were trying to bill Medicare twice as I will be filing a complaint with them. My veterinarian offers better care.

I've been going to this medical center for about three months now.  Dr Christina is just excellent, very knowledgeable and kind. I just had my first chance to see Dr. Patel.  I cannot tell you how impressed I was with his care, concern and knowledge.  I have a basic health issue that affects all organs in my body and I could not have asked for a better doctor who's knowledge was even superior to other specialists I have seen.  . On top of that, though there may be a little fee for blood tests, it was so nice to be able to take care of that issue right at the office and then go get an X-ray so that I did not have to run on two other directions when I felt Ill to begin with.  The clinic was a wonderful addition when I could not wait for an appointment due to pain.. I highly recommend this office, all the employees are kind and helpful.  A small wait was not important compared to the care I received.

I asked for my hormones to be checked during my annual physical and the brazillian PA assured me that the result will reflect in my regular bloodwork. That was false. She kept pushing me to make second appointment so she can perform a pap smear on me. When I refused, she kept pushing me to make an appointment with their in house dermatologist. Overall, I felt like she didn't listen to my health concerns. . PRO: They always have appointments readily available. Probably due to the lack of patients.... CON: Get blood work and urine analysis done at labcorp. Windermere Medical Center will charge a $15 fee for in house lab work. None of this was disclosed to me. I did not fill out any paperwork acknowledging this before or during this appointment. Generally, they would collect payment before seeing the doctor or at least disclose this fee. I was asked to pay this $15 fee AFTER my blood work and urine sample was taken. Super deceptive, considering annual physical and bloodwork is covered by your insurance.

This place is horrendous.  They advertise themselves as urgent care but there is nothing urgent about them. They also have some of the highest employee turnover that I have ever seen. They are rude, impatient and have no idea what HIPAA is they will shout your social security number, name and address for all of the waiting room to hear. . Chiropractor is great but that's it.

Generic care and awful staff besides one sweet older lady.  I don't know why I've been going here for years.. Receptionist are the least helpful and today they took 45 minutes to realize they forgot I was there after they helped others that walked in the door after me.. Older blonde medical assistant is always helpful and kind.  She deserves a raise.. Doctors and medical staff give generic treatments and once I diagnosed myself while the doctor googled prescriptions that I was saying.

This review is entirely on Dr. Justin Napotnik, their chiropractor.  There should be 10 stars because this doctor is phenomenal!  I have had chiropractic care off and on for over 30 years and nobody has been as completely thorough and produced such amazing results as he does.   Let me tell you what my biggest problem was - my feet!  I had plantar fasciitis symptom from wearing slip resistant shoes.  I was completely relieved of all symptom in just a few visits.  I don't have insurance for chiropractic  - I just pay a reasonable fee each visit - which is often the same as a copay.  I needed to go a few times a week for a couple of months when I started with him, but it wasn't long before I didn't have to go often, at all.  I still stop in for maintenance from time to time.  That's the sign of an excellent doctor.

WARNING! This place could kill you! No joke... Not only is the receptionist condescending and inappropriate by asking what's wrong with you in the lobby in front of everyone, she request that you make your co-pay with cash... Seems Shady... But that's just the tip of the iceberg. . I was there for Bronchitis and had to take chest C-Rays 3 times because the technician kept messing up... The doctor, Nicole Colon, then forgot to call in my medication to Walgreens... Fast forward 1 week... I'm still not better and thought I should go back. I got the same Doctor, Nicole Colon. She gave me a shot and sent in a script to Walgeens... All good, right!? NO!!! . I am only allergic to 1 thing in this world; Codeine. They even ask everytime at the doc repeatedly which is annoying bc it seems like they can't read the chart... Nicole Colon prescribed me medication with Codeine which thankfully Walgreens caught and brought to my attention.... The only thing I would recommend about this facility is the chiropractor who is awesome! Other than that... Proceed at your own risk!

Dr. Patel and his team are excellent. I am a was to Orlando and glad I found this place.  My expectations were exceeded.  It was very clean, everyone was nice and very professional.  . I recommend them highly.  They took very good care of me and they were as quick and painless as possible.. Thanks!!!

Would not recommend to anyone who seeks to be an informed customer in their medical care. Medical care provided is not evidence based nor cost effective. I strongly encourage everyone to find a healthcare provider that you can trust and whom is up to date with current medical treatments and can explain the supporting evidence. Never allow a health care provider to perform a task, medical procedure, or administer medication just because a computer won't accept the information that has been placed. Yes, I strongly support medical care in all aspects immunizations, medical procedures etc. However these need to be justified procedures and not just because a computer won't accept a date.

This practice really cheated me.   I called them on the phone and they told me they could order me a lab test that I was requesting, so I then make an appointment.  I get there,  they charge me,  then they tell me they don't order that lab, and to get it from another practice.

Initially requested for appointment online, but there was no response.  Then left a voice mail,  still no response.  Called again and finally somebody answered and was able to make an appointment. . On the day of appointment, the Pediatrician ordered blood work for my 2 kids.  After a month I followed up the results and was told a nurse would call me.  It's been a week still no call.. The Pediatrician also made an endocrinology referral.  Endocrinology office had been calling for more than 2 weeks but this clinic never responded, and the specialit had to cancel our appointment.  . My husband had to go to this clinic to voice out our issues and all they said was they did not get a call from the Orlando Health Endocrinology.   This clinic's phone # is published in every search engine and different employees from the hospital system had been calling them.  So judge which entity has more credibility....Something is terribly wrong in this clinic's practice.. Also, regarding the blood work results, my husband was told, they did not get the results from Doctor Phillips Hospital.  So is that the reason, why nobody even called back from this clinic? So if a patient has undiagnozed leukemia,  this Pediatric office will never know until later when it's too late.  They are not doing their work as PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS.. Their patient care stops as soon as they get their reimbursements from insurance companies. No more follow-up call or whatsoever.

Multiple primary care doctors over the years for our family of 4, as we've lived in 3 different states in the last 6 years. So impressed to see a physician and a chiropractor working together for the health of their patients, and not to simply promote pharmaceuticals. The care with Dr Patel has been excellent (our whole family has been in for various reasons and Dr. Napotnik (Chiro) is informative with what he does and has helped relieve issues with back pain.

I've been to see Dr Patel twice. The office is new, clean and exceedingly well maintained. New equipment, on-site labs and x-ray; it's just a very convenient location with some very nice folks. . Both visits were set up with relatively short notice. I had an appointment at 6 pm - how many doctors do you know who work that late? And it wasn't to see a nurse practitioner, either - though I've had good experiences with some NPs as well. . Bottom line - the prices are reasonable, the service well above average and the convenience is a 10/10. This is my doctor of choice, and I've recommended him to friends and family - and now to you. Feel free to reach out for details if you want more info.
I had Amy and she was rude and awful. Horrible bedside manner. Second time I've gotten her. Will probably not go back after this. Ridiculous and bad overall experience.

Disappointed. Front office staff rude and condescending.  Poorly represents the medical staff before patients ever get that far. Pressure you to vote this MD as number one before you EVEN MEET the MD. Shoving an iPad in my face to vote for him. (Can I meet the man first ?!?!). Disappointed in Dr. Patel who, during a recent physical, fixated more on a borderline EKG and completely overlooked the obvious signs (also my verbal report of) of bronchitis. Another doctor had to prescribe antibiotics and steroids.  Too quick to setup additional and costly exams. Shame. I had high hopes for this place. Will not return.
